intro: Phagnalon tenorei, commonly known as the Sicilian thistle, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its spiny, woolly leaves and purple or pinkish flowers. The plant is typically found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to withstand arid conditions. It has a compact growth habit and is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value. Phagnalon tenorei is also of interest in ecological studies due to its role in supporting local biodiversity.
